sourcesContent:
import React, {Component} from 'react'; class bookpage extends Component { constructor(props){ super(props) this.state ={ id:0, name: null, mobile: null, email: null, persons:null, date:null, time:null, resname:(this.props.match.params.res), bid:null } } async postData(name,mobile,email,persons,date,time,resname){ const response = await fetch('http://localhost:3001/booking',{ method: "POST", mode: "cors", headers:{'Content-type': 'application/json'}, body: JSON.stringify({ id : 0, name: name, mobile:mobile, email:email, persons:persons , date:date, time:time, resname:resname, }) }) const data= await response.json(); this.setState({bid:`Booking Successful!!!...Your Booking ID : ${data.ID} `}); } handleSubmit=(event)=>{ event.preventDefault() const data=this.state const res=data console.log(data) } handleInputChange=(event)=>{ event.preventDefault() //console.log(event) //console.log(event.target.name) console.log(event.target.value) this.setState({ [event.target.name]: event.target.value }) } render() { console.log(this.props.match.params.res); //const resname=(this.props.match.params.res); const {id,name,mobile,email,persons,date,time,resname,bid}=this.state console.log(`render${resname}`); return (




YOUR BOOKING ID WILL APPEAR HERE AFTER BOOKING




{bid}
Update Booking Information Cancel your Booking
); } }; export default bookpage;
